abstracts.cdata!:
The Resettlement Action Plan (RAP) will
            ensure that production levels, income-earning capacity, and
            living standards of the project-affected persons (PAPs),
            including minority groups, are improved, and/or restored to
            sustain their livelihoods. Therefore, the following measures
            will be taken to safeguard the entitlements of affected
            people: 1) ensure that all PAPs, including those living in
            urban state-owned land, receive compensation at replacement
            costs, for lost assets due to the project, and are
            resettled, and rehabilitated to be able to share the
            project's benefits; 2) particular attention will be
            given to vulnerable groups - including poor households,
            households with disabled members, households headed by
            women, and households where elderly people live alone - by
            providing assistance in building, and/or moving into their
            new houses; 3) full compensation, due to land acquisition
            will be provided at replacement costs; 4) affected units,
            and enterprises will be compensated for losses at
            replacement costs. Suitable alternative locations will be
            provided in case of relocation, to allow business
            continuity; 5) the community's services, and
            infrastructure will be restored/replaced as needed; 6) the
            independent monitoring institute will evaluate the
            implementation of land acquisition and resettlement issues,
            and include the participation of PAPs' representatives,
            who will be able to address possible grievances.
